t: Hear*p this word that the Lord*s has spoken against you, O people of Israel, against the whole family that I brought up out of the land of Egypt:
“You*pn only have I known of*ld all the families of the earth; therefore*ln I will punish you for*ld all your iniquities.
“Do*pn two walk together, unless*ld they have agreed to meet?
Does*ln a lion roar in the forest, when*ld he has no prey? Does*ln a young lion cry out from his den, if*ld he has taken nothing?
Does*ln a bird fall in a snare on the earth, when*ld there is no trap for it? Does*ln a snare spring up from the ground, when*ld it has taken nothing?
Is*ln a trumpet blown in a city, and*ld the people are not afraid? Does*ln disaster come to a city, unless*ld the Lord*s has done it?
“For*pn the Lord God*s does nothing without*ld revealing his secret to*ld his servants the prophets.
The*ln lion has roared; who*ld will not fear? The*ln Lord God*s has spoken; who*ld can but prophesy?”

Proclaim*pn to the strongholds in Ashdod and*ld to the strongholds in the land of Egypt, and*ln say, “Assemble yourselves on the mountains of Samaria, and*ld see the great tumults within her, and*ld the oppressed in her midst.”
“They*ln do not know how to do right,” declares the Lord,*s “those*ld who store up violence and robbery in their strongholds.”
Therefore*p thus says the Lord God:*s “An*pn adversary shall surround the land and*ld bring down your defenses from you, and*ld your strongholds shall be plundered.”

Thus*p says the Lord:*s “As the shepherd rescues from the mouth of the lion two legs, or a piece of an ear, so shall the people of Israel who dwell in Samaria be rescued, with the corner of a couch and part of a bed.
“Hear,*pn and testify against the house of Jacob,” declares*ld the Lord God,*s the God of hosts,
“that*ln on the day I punish Israel for his transgressions, I*ld will punish the altars of Bethel, and*ln the horns of the altar shall be cut off and*ld fall to the ground.
I*ln will strike the winter house along with the summer house, and*ld the houses of ivory shall perish, and*ln the great houses shall come to an end,” declares*l the Lord.*s
